Description.val:
Modernization/maintenance efforts support LCS requirements to remain operational and meet mission needs. This line provides funding for mandatory safety design changes, cyber security remediation actions, habitability modifications, and obsolescence and reliability resolution to maintain Littoral Combat Ships (LCS) operational availability and achieve the full expected service life. Funding covers planned CNO availabilities and includes two years of planning costs and long lead time materials (LLTM).

MT001 - Habitability Modification
Habitability Modifications: Modifications to increase the permanent berths to 98 on the FREEDOM and INDEPENDENCE variants for LCS 11, 13-20 during Post Shakedown Availability. The FREEDOM variant change also includes increased refrigeration (chill and freeze), increased dry provision stores, increased potable water capability, increased solid waste storage, and laundry capability, to support the increase in core crew size from 40 to 50 personnel. As a result of the congressional reduction, the modification on INDEPENDENCE variant ships will include only berthing spaces to 98 and dry provision storage capacity.
Non-Rack Hab Modifications: Funding for LCS 5-8 Habitability Mod efforts not completed during the Post Shakedown Availabilities (PSA).  These efforts include increased solid waste storage, refrigeration and freezer capacity, reverse osmosis plant capacity and dry provision storage capacity and will be accomplished during the first Selected Restricted Availability (SRA) for each ship.   

MT002 - LCS Ships Class Safety Design Changes
Safety modifications fund the redesigned stern ramp back-fit on five FREEDOM variant ships (LCS 11/13/15/17/19) to support 11M Rigid Hull Inflatable Boats (RHIB) operations and the installation of bridge wings for safe and effective operation of four INDEPENDENCE variant ships (LCS 14/16/18/20). Safety design changes will be incorporated in-line for LCS 21 and follow.  This funding also supports installation of the Man Overboard Indicator (MOBI) system on LCS 9-20. Note: Earlier ships changes were completed in prior years. 

MT003 - LCS Maintenance Modernization
Modernization funds back-fit and fact-of-life obsolescence changes on the Littoral Combat Ships (LCS) to include:
- Mandatory Safety changes eliminate or reduce hazards to ship personnel or components. Safety considerations include human (includes human/system interfaces), toxic/hazardous materials and substances, testing, logistical support, weapons, and munitions/explosives. 
- Cyber Security changes protect data and information processed by installed networks and information systems. This includes hardware, software, and firmware that provide integrity, confidentiality, non-repudiation, identification and authentication, and availability of shipboard systems.
- Obsolescence changes are required to prevent systems from becoming incompatible with newer technologies, or to update systems.
- Reliability changes are key to the LCS reaching its full operational capabilities for the entire service life. System and structural reliability modifications will increase the LCS Operational Availability Ao and performance, while decreasing life-cycle maintenance costs.
- Maintainability changes improve ease of system maintenance by increasing the average time between required maintenance activities and reduce the Mean Time To Repair (MTTR).

MT004 - LCS Maintenance and Modernization - Lethality and Survivability (L&S) 
Provides for hardware procurement and installation of a common Combat Management System (CMS), government furnished equipment and associated technical/logistic support data to upgrade the existing contractor furnished equipment, with associated cybersecurity modifications, that will be back-fit onboard in-service LCS platforms.  Funding will also provide the for non-recurring engineering to develop Ship Change Documents (SCDs) necessary to integrate and test the common software baseline for two different LCS Class variants - FREEDOM and INDEPENDENCE.  Production support services for these upgrades are phased over a three (3) year span starting two (2) years prior to installation on a per hull basis, with installation to be accomplished during planned CNO Availabilities.  The official schedule and durations for CNO Availabilities is maintained by Commander Naval Surface Force Atlantic and Pacific in the Navy Data Environment (NDE) and is subject to change to accommodate port loading and dry dock availability.

The funding for Design Services Allocation begins two years prior to the start of an Availability. The official schedule for CNO Availabilities is maintained in the Navy Data Environment (NDE) and updated by Commander Naval Surface Force Atlantic and Pacific schedulers. The CNO approved schedule for LCS Availabilities included in the requirements is as follows:

FY19: LCS 2, LCS 4

FY20: LCS 1, LCS 5, LCS 6, LCS 8

FY21: LCS 3, LCS 7, LCS 9, LCS 10, LCS 12, LCS 14

FY22: LCS 2, LCS 4, LCS 6, LCS 11, LCS 13, LCS 16

FY23: LCS 1, LCS 3, LCS 5, LCS 7, LCS 8, LCS 15, LCS 17, LCS 18, LCS 20, LCS 22

FY24: LCS 9, LCS 10, LCS 12, LCS 14, LCS 19, LCS 21, LCS 23, LCS 24

Justification.val:
MT001 - Habitability Modification
FY 2020 funds modifications increase the permanent berths to 98 on two FREEDOM variant ships (LCS 17/19) to be installed during the Post Shakedown Availability (PSA) period. 

MT002 - LCS Ships Class Safety Design Changes
FY 2020 funds safety modifications address the final two of five redesigned stern ramp back-fit on FREEDOM variant ships (LCS 17/19) during PSA.
 
MT003 - LCS Maintenance Modernization
Littoral Combat Ships (LCS) Maintenance Modernization funding includes Ship Change Documents (SCD) for cyber, reliability, obsolescence, maintainability, and safety efforts/alterations required by the Navy for the LCS Class to maintain Authority to Operate (ATO). The scope/requirements for maintenance modernization include 112 SCD/alterations and 1,051 planned installations (across the FYDP) during LCS CNO availabilities driven/maintained by the NDE, the Navy's centralized database and web-based application used to manage Navy Modernization, Maintenance, Logistics, and Workload/Performance.

NDE monitors/maintains the LCS Class availabilities for their scheduled modification by Hull, by year to include the advanced planning, procurement and installation of all modernization/SCD's to the LCS class. Modernization SCDs include: Total Ship Computing Environment (TSCE) Hardware/Software Upgrade, NAVLAN Server Tech Refresh, SPS-77 Tech Refresh, ES 3601 ESM Tech Refresh, ICMS Software Upgrade, ICMS Upgrade Cyber Fixes, MK-27 Gun Fire Control, TCSE Cyber Security Layer Defense Enhancements, Galley Habitability, USV Integration, Fire Pump Modifications, Isolation Valves in Oil Cooling System, Water mist Firefighting System Mod. Long lead material procurement, advance planning and design services allocation (DSA) need to be funded up to two years in advance of installations in accordance with planning milestones.

MT004 LCS Lethality and Survivability 
Lethality and Survivability (L&S) funds upgrades to include:
- The FY18 Congressional add covered procurement of four (4) shipsets of Over the Horizon (OTH) missile launcher systems, Identification of Friend or Foe (IFF) Mode 5 equipment, and Beyond Line of Sight (BLOS) data link components to backfit onto both LCS Class Variant ships.  Also funded was a shore-based testing/certification/engineering analysis infrastructure operated as the Littoral Warfare Engineering Capability (LWEC) to validate engineering changes, software upgrades, and in-service product improvements before installing on ships.

- Lethality and Survivability funding will provide for hardware procurement and installation of a common Combat Management System (CMS), government furnished equipment and associated technical/logistic support data to upgrade the existing contractor furnished equipment, with associated cybersecurity modifications, that will be back-fit onboard in-service LCS platforms.  Funding will also provide for the non-recurring engineering to develop Ship Change Documents (SCDs) necessary to integrate and test the common software baseline for two different LCS Class variants - Freedom and Independence.  Production support services for these upgrades are phased over a three (3) year span starting two (2) years prior to installation on a per hull basis, with installation to be accomplished during planned CNO Availabilities.

Name.@footnote: CE 1.2/1.4 MT001 - Habitability Mod, Non-Rack:  FY19 Habitability Mod Budget was transferred from OPN Budget BLI 0944 to FY19 OPN Budget BLI 1604 to be executed during the ship's first Selected Restricted Availability (SRA).

Name.val: 2) MT002 LCS Ship Class Safety Design Changes

Name.@footnote: MT002 Bridge Wings - Bridge Wing installations, initially planned for PSA, are to be installed during the Industrial Post Delivery Availability (IPDA) period.  This safety modification change was requested by the Fleet to be installed prior to ship sailaway.

Name.val: 2.3) FY18 Congressional Add - OTH, IFF Mode 5, BLOS, LWEC

Description.val:
LCS Maintenance Modernization
Modernization funds back-fit and fact-of-life obsolescence changes on the Littoral Combat Ships (LCS) to include:
- Mandatory Safety changes eliminate or reduce hazards to ship personnel or components. Safety considerations include human (includes human/system interfaces), toxic/hazardous materials and substances, testing, logistical support, weapons, and munitions/explosives. 
- Cyber Security changes protect data and information processed by installed networks and information systems. This includes hardware, software, and firmware that provide integrity, confidentiality, non-repudiation, identification and authentication, and availability of shipboard systems.
- Obsolescence changes are required to prevent systems from becoming incompatible with newer technologies, or to update systems.
- Reliability changes are key to the LCS reaching its full operational capabilities for the 35 year service life. System and structural reliability modifications will increase the LCS Operational Availability Ao and performance, while decreasing life-cycle maintenance costs.
- Maintainability changes improve ease of system maintenance by increasing the average time between required maintenance activities and reduce the Mean Time To Repair (MTTR).

The funding for Design Services Allocation begins two years prior to the start of an Availability. The official schedule for CNO Availabilities is maintained in the Navy Data Environment (NDE) and updated by Commander Naval Surface Force Atlantic and Pacific schedulers. The CNO approved schedule for LCS Availabilities included in the requirements is as follows:

FY19: LCS 2, LCS 4

FY20: LCS 1, LCS 5, LCS 6, LCS 8

FY21: LCS 3, LCS 7, LCS 9, LCS 10, LCS 12, LCS 14

FY22: LCS 2, LCS 4, LCS 6, LCS 11, LCS 13, LCS 16

FY23: LCS 1, LCS 3, LCS 5, LCS 7, LCS 8, LCS 15, LCS 17, LCS 18, LCS 20, LCS 22

FY24: LCS 9, LCS 10, LCS 12, LCS 14, LCS 19, LCS 21, LCS 23, LCS 24

Production support services for these upgrades are phased over a three (3) year span starting two years prior to installation on a per hull basis, with installation to be accomplished during planned CNO Availabilities.
